RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WAYNE'S HOPE quickly took over and opened up a long early lead, came under pressure into the turn, flattened later yards and just lasted. MOTIVATED SPEAKER chased inside and raced near the rail on the turn, angled to the six path toward the top of the lane and just missed in a strong finish. TRICKY STRONG chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. ASTRAL RIDE gave chase through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. RIDUNCULOUS chased toward the outside, rounded the turn about the five path and raced evenly in the stretch. BUCKS LODGE chased inside, steadied at the rail into the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. BROTHERFROMANOTHER chased through the backstretch then faded on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Wayne's Hope
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilbert Melissa Rentz and Oxendine Martin
ENTRY.COMMENT: long early lead,pressured 1/4,rail turn,flattened late,just lastd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 84. Starter Allowance Purse 23000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JANUARY 5, 2021. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 5 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 5 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where En tered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DULCIMER DAME stalked two deep then bid approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead passing the quarter pole, drew clear inside the eighth and was kept alert through the lane. SHERIFF'S KID rated close off the rail, bid past the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then dug in the final furlong to take second late strides. BETCHA BY GOLLY rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met past the quarter, continued close at the rail through the far turn but dropped back passing the eighth pole and relented second late strides. CHINA CAT rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn then flattened stride. MARKETABILITY settled in the three path the first turn and entered the backstretch outside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. SAX saved ground. MAGIC IN ME stalked the earlier pace from the four path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff's Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid past 5/16,rail far turn,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: China Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MI YAYIS set a pressured pace through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and sustained an edge under steady handling. RED PRIESTESS engaged in close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and finished well, while running out of ground. SUPERSNAKE gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn and ran evenly in the lane. ULTIMATE BREEZE chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and finished well. JESS FOR KICKS pressured the pace inside, steadied at the rail nearing the quarter pole then weakened in the lane. AMERICAS WOMAN chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and finished well. MY BRIDGET VERDOT gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and flattened stride. BALLYMENA gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. HOLY PINK gave chase then flattened in the three path on the turn. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Mi Yayis for alleged interference nearing the quarter pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Jess for Kicks
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,steadied rail near 1/4,weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mi Yayis
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,off rail turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISTER DEEKS took over while tapering to the inside and rated a slim lead, was met leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled at mostly even terms from that point, contested the edge through the turn and dug in determinedly to hold off the game stretch challenge of CRISTIANO BOY, who rated close inside and started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, was eased to the four path on the far turn and dug in gamely under steady stretch encouragement to take second in the final strides while being outfinished for the win. COLONIAL ROAD stalked two deep then challenged at even terms leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the far turn, relented to the winner and was outfinished for second in the final strides. COMEONTURNMELOOSE hit the gate on exit then settled off the rail on the opening turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, dueled to near even terms at the five sixteenths, raced three wide on the far turn then flattened later yards. ROCKET BALLAD exchanged contact with Hardin leaving the gate and rounded the first turn in the three path, left the turn outside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and showed little in the lane. CHARTERED COURSE settled in the two and three paths the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took a brief slim lead three wide approaching the five sixteenths, but dropped back from between horses midway on the far turn and weakened. HARDIN exchanged contact with Rocket Ballad leaving the gate, saved ground on the turns and could only close the gap.

ENTRY.NAME: Hardin
ENTRY.OWNER: Payne Jr Claude G and Tran Alex

ENTRY.NAME: Cristiano Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid 3/8,4p far turn,game stretch duel,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Comeonturnmeloose
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate break,off rail,eased out 1/2,challenge 5/16,flatten late

ENTRY.NAME: Mister Deeks
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,met 7/16,dueled,off rail turn,held on determined

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Lugamo Racing Stable LLC and J R Sanchez Racing Stable

RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY JUBA stalked two deep the first turn then challenged leaving the half mile pole, took the lead passing the quarter, edged clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. FASHION ICON raced well off the pace about the three path on the opening turn, started a bid leaving the turn and steadily improved at the rail on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch for second. MISS LAUREN settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. JALEBI BABY was bumped outward and into Boca Birdie, rounded the first turn about the four path and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. WEST VIRGINIA PAM was bumped outward and into Jaleby Baby leaving the gate then saved ground, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. BOCA BIRDIE was bumped at the break and saved ground on the first turn, left the turn well back, rounded the far turn near the rail and could only improve her position. DYLADDIE was bumped by the loose Excuses Excuses at the three quarter pole then settled inside, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. WALK A FINE LINE rated a slim lead inside, dug in to the challenge of My Juba leaving the half mile pole, succumbed to that one at the quarter pole, dropped back midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. MAGNIFICENT ROCKET rounded the opening turn in the five path and showed little response through the backstretch. EXCUSES EXCUSES ducked outward and into West Virginia Pam after the start and dislodged her rider.

ENTRY.NAME: Boca Birdie
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,saved ground,rail far turn,improved position

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 5, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since July 5 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Consi dered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POSITIVE PHIL rated a slim lead from the five eighths pole, pulled clear past the half, was hand urged into the far turn then pressured to widen further in the lane. ELVIRUS saved ground off the pace on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced in the four path of the far turn, then dug in down the lane to take second later yards. SIR ROCKPORT saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. JUNGLE WARRIOR stalked inside from the five eighths pole, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths and rounded the far turn about the three path, then flattened in the lane. NEVER COMPROMISE raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. CLASSY SOLUTION rounded the first turn in the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. UNCLE JEROME was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Jerome
ENTRY.OWNER: Quaintance Janet and Hickory Made Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Elvirus
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,4p far turn,up 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 24200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE JANUARY 5, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 5 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 5 Allo wed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ THE REASON rated a short lead, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. COLLEGE KID chased toward the inside, raced off the rail on the turn and held on for second. SUPER WILDCAT raced well back early, rounded the turn at the rail and started a bid into the lane, drifted outward in later yards and made contact with R Working Girl but got up for third the final strides. VALID REASON chased through the backstretch, raced in the six path on the turn, left the turn outside and ran evenly in the stretch. UNLOCK chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened. R WORKING GIRL chased, rounded the turn in the three path then bumped outward and into FLAT DISCOUNT late stretch. The latter chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path of the turn, flattened in the lane and was bumped late. COACH RUBE chased outside, raced in the six path of the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Super Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back early,rail turn,dug in lane,drifted,bumped late,up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: College Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Reason
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated short lead,pressured 1/4,rail turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TWEET THIS stalked off the rail, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close in the three path of the far turn, took the nod past the eighth pole and dug in to edge clear late yards. REY O REYES rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met past the eighth pole, but stayed competitive to deep stretch before reluctantly ceding late yards. SULEMAN settled in the three path on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the three path, eased out leaving the turn and finished well while gaining on the top two. ICE BAR saved early ground, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and passed rivals in the lane. INGREIDO exchanged contact with EARTHQUAKEDIRECTOR leaving the gate and settled off the rail on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenth pole but flattened in the three path of the far turn. The latter exchanged contact with Ingreido leaving the gate, rounded the first turn in the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. LUNAR IMAGE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. SKIP THE BULL stalked off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded at the rail on the far turn. FEISTY KITTEN rounded the first turn about the four path, was never a factor and saved ground on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Bar
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,3p far turn,passed rivals lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ingreido
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,flattened 3p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Tweet This
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,bid 7/16,close 3p far turn,nod lane,edged clear
